Line 20: Line 20:
==Modeling career==
==Modeling career==
  +
[[Image:Twiggy promo.jpg|thumb|Twiggy during the 1960s]]
In 1966, Nigel Davies noticed the young Lesley Hornby and offered her a modelling contract. She was only 16 and weighed 6Â½ stone (41 kg, 90 lbs).<ref>Cheever, Susan (May 1983). [http://www.nytimes.com/specials/magazine4/articles/twiggy.html Twiggy]. ''[[New York Times]]''. Accessed 2007-04-17.</ref> Davies advised her to go by her childhood nickname, Twiggy. After sweeping England as "The Face of '66" when her modeling pictures, taken by Barry Lategan, were made public, Twiggy arrived in New York in March 1967. It was believed that the Twiggy craze would die down within a month; however, she became an icon. Known for the [[high fashion]] [[Mod (lifestyle)|mod]] look created by [[Mary Quant]], Twiggy changed the world of fashion with her short-haired [[androgynous]] look.{{Fact|date=April 2009}} She was also famous for drawing long, fake eyelashes under her bottom lashes.
In 1966, Nigel Davies noticed the young Lesley Hornby and offered her a modelling contract. She was only 16 and weighed 6Â½ stone (41 kg, 90 lbs).<ref>Cheever, Susan (May 1983). [http://www.nytimes.com/specials/magazine4/articles/twiggy.html Twiggy]. ''[[New York Times]]''. Accessed 2007-04-17.</ref> Davies advised her to go by her childhood nickname, Twiggy. After sweeping England as "The Face of '66" when her modeling pictures, taken by Barry Lategan, were made public, Twiggy arrived in New York in March 1967. It was believed that the Twiggy craze would die down within a month; however, she became an icon. Known for the [[high fashion]] [[Mod (lifestyle)|mod]] look created by [[Mary Quant]], Twiggy changed the world of fashion with her short-haired [[androgynous]] look.{{Fact|date=April 2009}} She was also famous for drawing long, fake eyelashes under her bottom lashes.
